content: 3 now work your second a triangle as above from * to * p1 again you are at the top of the triangle with 16/18 sts forming each side but this time you are facing the ws with a free needle p the 16/18 sts down the left side of your triangle hiding wraps as you come to them see schematic you are now ready to work the first of the b triangles you are at the tip of a triangle pointing to the cuff **row 1 ws p1 wrap next st turn row 2 rs k2 work next sts with its wrap k1 wrap next st turn row 3 ws p4 work next st with its wrap p1 wrap next st turn row 4 rs k6 work next st with its wrap k1 wrap next st turn repeat row 3 and 4 increasing the number of k or p sts by2 your last worked row will be p28/32 work next sts with its wrap p1 wrap next st turn k30/34 work next sts with its wrap wrap next st this st will be on the next needle as it belongs to the other half of your sock turn p31/35 work next sts with its wrap** you have now filled in the first valley between your two a triangles ready to fill in the second one by working the second b triangle again p the 16/18 sts down the left side of your a triangle hiding wraps as you come to them see schematic work the second b triangle as above from ** to ** please note that on the ws row both of the two new sts that you will bring into play will be wrapped this is because we have not worked our way down that side of the triangle in a previous step wrap next st this st will be on the next needle as it belongs to the other half of your sock turn you have now completed the first tier you should be at the meeting point of three triangles 2 b and 1 a if you compare your position to where you started out with the cuff i e where your yarn tail is left hanging you should see that you have shifted a ¼ of a round or 16/18 sts work the next and any subsequent tier exactly as the first starting at * please note that in the very first row the last st will already be wrapped so you need to end the row by giving the last st a second wrap when you later k down the side of that first a triangle you will need to work that st with both its wraps when you have worked enough tiers to reach your desired leg length proceed to the heel heel row 1 rs k31/35 wrap next st turn row 2 ws p30/34 wrap next st turn broken jack page 4 proceed like this working one st less each row
